traffic-light: often mounted on poles, overhead wires, or attached to signal arms
presence of regulatory signage nearby (e.g., stop signs, pedestrian signals)
treadmill: safety key or clip often attached to the panel
buttons for speed and incline adjustment
triceratops: four sturdy legs with hooved toes
often depicted in a prehistoric or natural landscape setting
tricycle: sometimes colorful and designed for children
often a small front wheel compared to the rear wheels
trilobite-101: Segmented body with three distinct lobes (left pleural lobe, central axial lobe, right pleural lobe)
tripod: a mounting plate or head for attaching a camera or other device
locking mechanisms on the legs or head
often made of metal, carbon fiber, or plastic
t-shirt: generally loose-fitting and casual in style
often has graphics, logos, or text on the front or back
typically made of cotton or a cotton blend
tuning-fork: a round handle or stem at the base of the fork
prongs often have a rounded end
tweezer: arms connected at one end, creating a pincer-like mechanism
typically silver, black, or brightly colored
umbrella-101: Long, central shaft (often metal or wood)
Spokes or ribs extending from the shaft to support the canopy
Tip at the top of the shaft
Collapsible mechanism (may be manual or automatic)
unicorn: frequently depicted in white or other bright colors
a single, spiraled horn on its forehead
typically depicted in fantasy or mythical settings
vcr: buttons and controls on the front panel (e.g., play, stop, rewind)
branding or model information typically on the front or top
video-projector: input ports for connecting to other devices (HDMI, VGA, USB)
sometimes accompanied by a remote control
cooling vents or fans on the sides or back
control buttons or a small control panel on the top or sides
washing-machine: water hoses or connections at the back
a detergent drawer (often for front-loading machines)
watch-101: May have additional features like sub-dials, date windows, or digital displays
A strap or band that may be made of leather, metal, plastic, or fabric
A crown or dial on the side for adjusting time
A small, typically circular or rectangular face/dial
waterfall: A body of water, such as a river or stream, feeding into the waterfall
A pool or basin of water at the bottom
Mist or spray near the base of the falling water
Movement blur of water captured in the photo
watermelon: textured or smooth surface on the rind
numerous black or white seeds embedded in the flesh (if cut open)
vibrant red or pink flesh (if cut open)
welding-mask: often made of thick, heat-resistant materials
wheelbarrow: a large, open container or tray
two handles extending from the back
typically made of metal or plastic
usually found in construction sites, gardens, or farms
windmill: large, rotating blades or sails attached to a central hub
materials such as wood, metal, or concrete
wine-bottle: a label with winery information, type of wine, and other details
cork, screw cap, or other closure at the top
xylophone: bars of varying lengths (longer bars produce lower pitches, shorter bars produce higher pitches)
resonator tubes beneath the bars (in some models)
mallets or sticks typically used to play the instrument
often a frame or stand supporting the bars
bars arranged in a horizontal layout
yarmulke: can be knit, cloth, or suede
fits snugly without straps or ties
might be seen in religious or ceremonial contexts
may be worn by males, especially within Jewish communities
yo-yo: a string winding around the axle
may have a small knob or indentation in the center for gripping
can be a variety of colors
some models might have design patterns or logos on the discs
zebra: long tail with a tuft of hair at the end
airplanes-101: a fuselage (the main body of the airplane)
airlines' specific livery or logos (for commercial airplanes)
car-side-101: Side mirrors protruding near the front windows
Wheels and tires visible along the bottom
greyhound: thin face with a long muzzle
toad: short legs relative to body size
clutter: Lack of clear organization or arrangement
Possible presence of disorganization that causes visual chaos
Varied sizes, shapes, and colors of objects
